intro: Proserpinaca platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited proserpinaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a three-lobed capsule that contains numerous seeds. Proserpinaca platycarpa is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
